titleStmt.title: Nat Wiley et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7366

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excelency the Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Owen County would respectfully represent that on the 30th day of October 1865 that Thomas Hall of said county was taken tried before Franklin Mathews Justice of the peace for Owen County on a charge for an affray and breach of the peace and the finding of the jury was the full penalty of the law $30,, and 15 days imprisonment now we would represent to you that ^we^ dont under any circumstanc Justify or incourage any violation of law yet we feel that the finding of the Court was heavy and ^we^ earnestly unite in requesting you to interpose and remit said fines or a least give such relief as you may think best &c &c

Nat Wiley J P o c
J L Marland
J I Marland
Henry Mitchel
A. G. Rice
Isaac Green
John T. Southworth
B F Wiley
S Butler
E Caber
L Samel
J D Hutcherson
H, H, Head
John ,S, Graves
P, U, Major
N Alley
J. A. Critenden
E Jenkins
Thos J Ford
Geo W Lawler
E. Craig
Jas W Tate
Jno. L. Neal
J Dailey
John Hawl personally Apeared befor me a justic of the Pec and maid oath that this names is all men of the Saim neybrHood that the chay

Owen County
Justice Court
vs
Thos Hall
$30, &
15 days Imprisonment
Remitted 8th Nov 1865
Petition
